intro: Euphrasia collina var. typica, commonly known as the hill eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and lance-shaped. The species is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
